existing_features.title: Create a responsive multi-page marketing website for “KK Euro Express” courier service with the following public pages: Home, Services, About, Contact.
Define and apply a coherent visual theme suitable for a courier/logistics brand (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and use it consistently across all pages.
Implement a Home page that includes: a hero section (headline + subheadline), key value propositions (3–6 items), a “Services” preview, and a prominent call-to-action leading to the Contact page.
Implement a Services page that presents courier offerings in a clear, scannable format (service cards/sections) and includes a simple “How it works” section (e.g., Request pickup → Ship → Deliver).

Implement an About page describing the company and emphasizing reliability, coverage, and customer service, with a section for service areas/coverage (kept generic if exact geography is not provided).

Add a Contact page with a contact form (name, email/phone, subject, message) that submits to the backend and shows success/error states. Also include a section for business contact details (placeholders allowed until provided).
Add a site footer with consistent branding and quick links to the main pages, plus a small legal line (e.g., copyright).

Generate and include static brand imagery as local assets and render them in the UI (hero graphic and logo). Store generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.

Update the Home page hero section background styling so the homepage background looks more polished and intentional while keeping the existing hero content and layout intact (headline, copy, CTAs, and hero image). The updated background must maintain strong text contrast and readability across common viewport sizes.
Update the site footer contact information to display: Email `eurobanga@gmail.com`, Phone `79736-73529`, and `Available 24/7`.
Update the footer 'Services' list so it includes the services specified by the user: International courier, Domestic courier, Vacuum service, and Indo-Canadian bus service.

Update the Services page content to include offerings for International courier, Domestic courier, Vacuum service, and Indo-Canadian bus service in the services grid (using clear English service titles and short descriptions).

Update all user-facing marketing copy that describes service coverage as Europe/European/Pan-European so it instead clearly states coverage is across Punjab (keep the brand name “KK Euro Express” unchanged). This includes updating headings and paragraphs in the About page coverage section, the standalone CoverageSection component, and any Home page hero/value proposition text that mentions Europe.

Update secondary components that contain Europe-based marketing copy to align with Punjab-wide coverage messaging (e.g., services preview cards and footer brand description), ensuring wording remains natural and consistent across the site.

Update all user-facing coverage/region marketing copy to state KK Euro Express ships across Europe and also to international destinations, explicitly mentioning example destinations: UK, USA, Canada, and Italy (and wording like “and more”). Apply this consistently across pages/components that currently mention “Punjab” coverage (e.g., Home hero headline/paragraph, About page hero and overview copy, About “Our Coverage” intro, CoverageSection, ValueProps, HowItWorks step text, ServicesPreview descriptions, and footer brand blurb).

Increase the prominence of “Contact Us” across the site by adding stronger, more frequent contact CTAs without changing the existing contact details (email/phone/24/7). Implement at least: (1) a prominent Contact CTA in the site header on desktop, and (2) an additional Contact/Quote CTA section on the Services page that links to /contact.

Ensure the Contact page “Contact Information” panel does not display unrelated placeholder contact values when backend contact details are not yet loaded; it must default to the known business email and phone already used in the footer.

Remove all mentions of “Same day delivery” (including variants like “same-day”) from user-facing site content and service descriptions, and replace with wording that does not promise same-day delivery.

Improve basic SEO/discoverability by adding standard meta tags to the HTML entry (title, meta description, canonical URL, Open Graph tags) using the brand name “KK Euro Express” and accurate courier/logistics wording.
Add `robots.txt` and `sitemap.xml` as static public assets so search engines can crawl the main pages (/, /services, /about, /contact).

Remove the placeholder website value shown to users and instead display a correct official website URL: use the backend-provided `contactDetails.website` when present; otherwise fall back to the current site origin (e.g., `https://<current-host>`).
Add a simple, user-facing “Share our website” snippet (in English) on the Contact page that explains users can share the official website URL to let others find and open the site.
Add support for hosting a user-provided video file as a static frontend asset and embed it on the website in a polished, responsive section.
Ensure embedding the video does not change the existing public website link/domain and does not introduce any new routes that would break existing navigation.

Add a clear developer-facing note in the repository (e.g., in a README or a short comment near the embed code) describing exactly where to place/replace the video file and what filename the embed expects.

Add the user-uploaded JPEG ("WhatsApp Image 2025-12-16 at 1.19.45 PM-1.jpeg") to the frontend as a static public asset and reference it via a stable URL path that the Home page can load without backend involvement.

Update the Home page media section (VideoSection) so that when the video cannot be loaded, it displays the uploaded image instead of only showing the "Video content is currently unavailable." message.

Update frontend/VIDEO_ASSET.md to document both: (1) where to place/replace the video asset, and (2) where to place/replace the image fallback asset and the exact URL/path the VideoSection expects for the fallback image.

Update the Home page media section (frontend/src/components/site/VideoSection.tsx) to promote the Instagram account `kkeuroexpress_banga` by changing the section copy to “Watch our videos on Instagram” (English) and adding a clear outbound link/button that opens the Instagram profile at `https://instagram.com/kkeuroexpress_banga` in a new tab.

Add an Instagram link in the site footer (frontend/src/components/site/SiteFooter.tsx) that points to `https://instagram.com/kkeuroexpress_banga` and clearly labels the handle in English (e.g., “Instagram: @kkeuroexpress_banga”).

Update all user-facing website coverage/region marketing copy to remove any mentions of “Across Europe”, “Europe”, “Europe-wide”, or “Europe-Wide Deliveries”, and replace the coverage message with “Worldwide Shipping” (English). Apply this consistently anywhere coverage is described, including (at minimum) the Home page hero headline/paragraph, About page hero/overview and “Our Coverage” intro, CoverageSection headings/paragraphs, ValueProps items, HowItWorks step text, ServicesPreview card descriptions, and the SiteFooter brand description. Ensure “KK Euro Express” (brand name) remains unchanged.

Add the user-uploaded office image (use file: "WhatsApp Image 2025-12-17 at 9.56.35 AM.jpeg") to the frontend as a static public asset and ensure the website displays it in place of the currently shown fallback image (the image shown when the homepage VideoSection video cannot be loaded).

Add the business address to the website in English as: "Near Canara Bank, Main Rd, SBS Nagar, 144505" and display it in the site footer Contact section and in the Contact page “Contact Information” panel.

Extend backend contact details to include the business address "Near Canara Bank, Main Rd, SBS Nagar, 144505" and update the frontend to use the backend-provided address when available, with a fallback to the same known address if backend data is not yet loaded.

Replace the Home page VideoSection fallback image (served at public URL `/assets/video-fallback.jpeg`) with the newly uploaded image (`image-1.png`) so that when the video cannot be loaded, the site displays this new image instead of the previously used office image.
